{{cpp/io/basic_istream/title|unget}}
{{cpp/io/basic_istream/navbar}}
{{ddcl|
basic_istream&amp; unget();
}}

Makes the most recently extracted character available again.

{{rev inl|since=c++11|First, clears {{ltt|cpp/io/ios_base/iostate|eofbit}}. Then,}} {{tt|unget}} behaves as {{named req|UnformattedInputFunction}}. After constructing and checking the sentry object, if any {{lc|ios_base::iostate}} flags are set, the function sets {{tt|failbit}} and returns. Otherwise, calls {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;sungetc()}}.

If {{c|rdbuf()-&gt;sungetc()}} returns {{c|Traits::eof()}}, calls {{c|setstate(badbit)}}.

In any case, sets the {{tt|gcount()}} counter to zero.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

===Exceptions===
{{include|cpp/io/stream_exceptions}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::istringstream s1("Hello, world.");
    char c1 = s1.get();
    if (s1.unget())
    {
        char c2 = s1.get();
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "Got: '" &lt;&lt; c1 &lt;&lt; "'. Got again: '" &lt;&lt; c2 &lt;&lt; "'.\n";
    }
}
|output=
Got: 'H'. Got again: 'H'.
}}
